org.patneu.simpleflash

Class SimpleFlash

  • java.lang.Object
    • ActionBarActivity
      • org.patneu.simpleflash.SimpleFlash

  • public class SimpleFlash
extends ActionBarActivity
    The main class of this application that handles most of it's functionality (or at least delegates it to it's inner classes).

    Since:
    Version 1.0

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  SimpleFlash.FlashLightManager
      Inner class that handles the camera's flashlight.
      protected class  SimpleFlash.LockManager
      Inner class that handles most matters related to locking the screen.
      protected class  SimpleFlash.NotifyManager
      Inner class that handles all kinds of notifications shown to the user.
      protected class  SimpleFlash.PrefsManager
      Inner class that handles the saving and loading of the user preferences.
      protected class  SimpleFlash.SettingsManager
      Inner class that handles the settings of the application.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Performs the start up operations of this activity.

        Initializes the activity's ui elements, loads the start up preferences and sets the light on or off, based on isOnStart().
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - not actively used, only passed to the corresponding method of the super class
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        ActionBarActivity#onCreate(android.os.Bundle)

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        Performs the resume operations of this Activity.

        Loads the advanced preferences, sets the screen unlocked, turns the flashlight on or off - based on isLightOn() -, sets the corresponding background resource for the onOffButton and sends or cancels a CameraOnNotification - based on isFlashLightOn() and isNotificationShown().
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        ActionBarActivity#onResume()

      • onStop

        protected void onStop()
        Performs the stop operations of this Activity.

        Turns the flashlight on or off - based on isLightOn() and isInBackground() - and sends or cancels a CameraOnNotification - based on isFlashLightOn() and isNotificationShown().
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        ActionBarActivity#onStop()

      • onDestroy

        protected void onDestroy()
        Performs the last clean up operations of this Activity.

        Turns the flashlight off and cancels an active CameraOnNotification.
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        ActionBarActivity#onDestroy()

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                    int resultCode,
                    android.content.Intent data)
        Calls finish on this Activity on 'resultCode' RESULT_FINISHED from a started Activity.

        Other values for the 'resultCode' param are not handled. This method is used to finish this Activity if the exit item in the options menu of a started Activity is selected, so that the entire application is finishing.
        Parameters:
        requestCode - not actively used
        resultCode - the result of a started activity
        data - not actively used
        Since:
        Version 1.0

      • onNewIntent

        protected void onNewIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
        Calls finish on this Activity on action ACTION_FINISH of the 'intent' param.

        The 'intent' param is expected to be the Intent of a PendingIntent that was passed to a Notification before. This method is used to (possibly) finish this Activity if the Notification was clicked or cancelled by the user, depending on the users settings (see getNotificationClick(), getNotificationCancel() and CameraOnNotification.getInstance(android.content.Context, android.content.Intent, int, int) for details).

        Note: The 'intent' param is not set as the new Intent for this Activity as returned by #getIntent().
        Parameters:
        intent - the Intent of a PendingIntent passed to a notification before
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        ActionBarActivity#onNewIntent(android.content.Intent)

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu menu)
        Inflates the options menu for this Activity.

        Inflates either the 'main_actionbar_menu' or the 'lock_actionbar_menu' resource, depending on isScreenLocked().
        Parameters:
        menu - not actively used, only passed to the corresponding method of the super class and to {@link MenuInflater#inflate(int, android.view.Menu)
        Returns:
        the return value of the corresponding method of the super class
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        ActionBarActivity#onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu)

      • dispatchKeyEvent

        public boolean dispatchKeyEvent(android.view.KeyEvent event)
        Handles events from the volume keys, the back key and the menu key.

        This method intercepts the events to lock the keys - depending on isVolumeLocked(), isBackLocked() and isMenuLocked() - if the screen is locked and to turn the flashlight on and off using the volume keys - depending on isVolumeKeysUsed().

        It also sets the corresponding background resource for the onOffButton and sends or cancels a CameraOnNotification - based on isFlashLightOn() and isNotificationShown().
        Parameters:
        event - the KeyEvent to handle
        Returns:
        true if one of the keys specified above was handled in any way, the return value of the corresponding method of the super class otherwise
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        ActionBarActivity#dispatchKeyEvent(android.view.KeyEvent)

      • onButtonClicked

        public void onButtonClicked(android.view.View view)
        Handles clicks that are performed on the onOffButton, the onStartCheckbox and the inBackgroundCheckbox.

        Changes the corresponding settings and preferences when the onStartCheckbox or the inBackgroundCheckbox is clicked. Turns the flashlight on or off when the onOffButton is clicked. It also sets the corresponding background resource for the onOffButton and sends or cancels a CameraOnNotification - based on isFlashLightOn() and isNotificationShown().
        Parameters:
        view - the View that was clicked by the user
        Since:
        Version 1.0

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)
        Handles the selection of items in the options menu.

        Locks or unlocks the screen if the lockItem was selected and sends a corresponding Toast message. Opens the corresponding Activity if the settingsItem or the aboutItem was selected. Finishes the Activity or does nothing if the exitItem was selected - depending on isScreenLocked() and isExitLocked().
        Parameters:
        item - the MenuItem selected by the user
        Returns:
        true if the selected item was handled in any way and/or if the screen is locked, the return value of the corresponding method of the super class otherwise
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        ActionBarActivity#onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem)

      • setLightOn

        protected void setLightOn(boolean on)
        Sets whether the camera's flashlight should turn on.

        Note: This method sets only wether the light should turn on, but doesn't actually turn it on. Please refer to setFlashLightOn(boolean) for doing this.
        Parameters:
        on - wether the light should turn on
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        isLightOn()

      • isLightOn

        protected boolean isLightOn()
        Returns wether the camera's flashlight should be turned on.

        Note: This method returns only wether the light should be turned on, but not if it actually is turned on. Please refer to isFlashLightOn() for doing this.
        Returns:
        wether the camera's flashlight should be turned on
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        setLightOn(boolean)
